item.title: Higher Order Functions
item.description: Higher-order Functions - Any complicated function that was composed by combining simple functions is a higher order function. - Functions that operate on other functions, either by taking them as arguments or by returning them, are called higher-order functions. - Eloquent JavaScript - A higher-order function is a function that takes other functions as arguments and/or returns a function as it's result. - Wikipedia Notes Functions are values.

item.title: Book - Start Programming Now - No CS degree required
